labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to automate browser interactions, allowing LLMs to perform tasks such as taking screenshots, filling out forms, clicking elements, executing JavaScript, and navigating web pages. It supports HTTP requests, console logging, and interaction with iframes. The server is primarily focused on web automation, testing, and browser-based actions, making it a powerful tool for automating web tasks and testing web applications.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality revolves around browser automation, with tools that mimic user interactions, automate testing, and perform web scraping. This fits well into the "Browser Automation" category. Secondary labels include "Web Search & Research" due to its ability to gather web content and "Development Tools" because it can generate test code and assist in debugging web applications.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.author: @iiiusky/mcp-playwright
server_info_crawled.overview: Automate browser interactions effortlessly. Enable your LLMs to take screenshots, generate test code, and execute JavaScript in real browser environments with ease.

tools.name: start_codegen_session
tools.description: Deploy Server Playwright MCP Server @iiiusky/mcp-playwright Try in Playground start_codegen_session

tools.description: End a code generation session and generate the test file

tools.description: Get information about a code generation session

tools.description: Clear a code generation session without generating a test

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@iiiusky/mcp-playwright/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
